solution: The Angle Bisector Theorem tells us that  \[\frac{AC}{AX}=\frac{BC}{BX}\]so \[AX=\frac{AC\cdot BX}{BC}=\frac{21\cdot30}{45}=\boxed{14}.\]
model_solution:
According to the Angle Bisector Theorem, $\frac{AC}{AX}=\frac{BC}{BX}$.
$BX=\frac{BC}{45}=\frac{BC}{BC+21}$
$BC+BX=BC+\frac{BC}{45}=\frac{46}{45}BC$
steps: According to the Angle Bisector Theorem, $\frac{AC}{AX}=\frac{BC}{BX}$.
full_steps: According to the Angle Bisector Theorem, $\frac{AC}{AX}=\frac{BC}{BX}$.
